name: Chiricahua National Monument
description: Explore rhyolite pinnacles and balanced rocks on foot or by car. Relax at the campground under star-filled, dark skies. See how a mountain range rising between two deserts creates a home for diverse wildlife. Imagine history here. Prehistoric peoples, Apaches, Buffalo Soldiers, Civilian Conservation Corps, ranchers, and homesteaders inhabited Chiricahua.
shortDescription: Explore rhyolite pinnacles and balanced rocks on foot or by car. Relax at the campground under star-filled, dark skies. See how a mountain range rising between two deserts creates a home for diverse w...

operatingHours.description:
The road, campground, and facilities in the park are open overnight. Gates on the road will not be closed during overnight hours unless an emergency occurs. The park prohibits overnight parking, sleeping in vehicles, and camping outside the campground. 

 The trails stay open for sunrise, sunset, and night sky viewing. Be aware of wildlife and use extreme caution.

climate.weatherDescription: The park elevation goes from 5,124 feet at the entrance to 7,310 feet on Sugarloaf Mountain. The top of the park can be 5-10 degrees cooler and windier than the visitor center and entrance. The higher elevations generally have more sun exposure. Clothing layers are always recommended here. The park is often cooler than cities in Arizona with summer highs in the 80s and 90s. Winter lows are often near or below freezing.

images.title: View from Massai Point
images.altText: Many rock pinnacles with a valley and mountain range in background
images.caption: Massai Point offers excellent views of the standing rocks at Chiricahua

images.title: Faraway Ranch
images.altText: A ranch house in a green field surrounds by low mountains
images.caption: Faraway Ranch preserves the heritage of early European settlers in the Chiricahua Mountains

images.title: Echo Canyon Grotto
images.caption: The standing rocks at Chiricahua create natural nooks and crannies ready to be explored

images.title: Bonita Canyon
images.altText: A narrow road winds between tall oaks and rock cliffs
images.caption: Bonita Canyon Scenic Drive winds through standing rocks and rhyolite cliffs, climbing to Massai Point at 6900 ft / 2100 m.

images.title: Big Balanced Rock
images.altText: Large rock balanced on a small point
images.caption: Big Balanced Rock
